result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Ahlert

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert J. Ahlert appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Robert J. Ahlert.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard and requests a breakout room. 
9:01  am Breakout room
9:07 am Court resumes

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the case. Still waiting for the substances to be tested. 
State is heard. Set for Dec 1 status date and set trial dates.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert J. Ahlert appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Robert J. Ahlert.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert J. Ahlert appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Robert J. Ahlert.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard, they are ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 
State calls first witness. 

1W - Lieutenant Tara Henry - City of Prairie du Chien police department, Sworn
Exam by Atty Steiner 
Cross by Atty Erickson 

Comments by the State. Atty Steiner requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Erickson objects to bind over. 

Court puts findings on the records. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Case called - appearances stated. 

Defendant Robert J. Ahlert in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Erickson appears for Robert J. Ahlert by video

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.
Defendant states understanding.  

Court schedules Preliminary Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 11:15 AM

Atty. Erickson and def. placed into a breakout room to discuss bond modification (10:50 AM)
case recalled 10:56 AM

Atty Erickson states def. has no ability to post $300.00 cash, requests  signature bond. 
Atty. Steiner is heard on bond - is reasonable and appropriate as set.  Def. has failed to appear in another case and several warrants were issued in that case, opposes any bond modification

Court denies request for modification of bond - $300.00 cash bond remains
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert J. Ahlert appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County Jail. Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RJA.
 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RJA.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.
